direction.raw_text: Frank... I have to go. He opens his eyes and looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't go out. All you need is here. In four or five days everything will be resolved...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Resolved?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will all be over. I'll give you the all clear and you can go back to your life. This will be a great adventure you can look back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When will I see you again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never. She looks at him evenly; one last glance between two people from two completely different worlds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-bye, Frank. She leaves. INT. RUN DOWN PALAZZO, HALL - DAY She has started down the stairs when Frank appears on the landing. He leans over the balustrade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he worth it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get back inside. She has stopped mid-flight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to risk everything for him. Would he do the same for you? She is quite straightforward in her response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter. I love him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't deserve it. She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of this is your business anymore. Now get back inside Frank! Just as she raises her voice a door opens below them in the hall, and an old man comes out. He looks up at Cara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Signorina. This is exactly what she did not want. But she controls her annoyance, nods in greeting and continues towards the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mi dispiace, Signor. The Old Neighbor nods as Cara walks out the door. He admires Cara's shapely form as she crosses the cobblestone streets and disappears into the alley. He glances back up at Frank and whistles appreciatively. Frank turns and goes back inside. INT. INTERPOL FIELD HQ, VENICE - DAY Ackerman sits in an office chair, gently revolving. Jones, Goyal and Jean Luc are there as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do women find these con men so appealing? Jones is the only woman nearby...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look at me. I married my personal trainer. (sotto Jean Luc) She's twenty-six. Jean Luc can't tell if she's serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did Pearce seduce that beautiful woman? Was it his charm? His looks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks change. Ackerman sips from his ten thousandth cup of espresso.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's because if he adores himself and spends every moment gratifying his desires, so then can she. He looks around to see if the others like this theory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can become a child again. Who wouldn't want that? There is a bitterness in Ackerman's tone that reveals he is personally hurt by this. Goyal's Blackberry makes a beep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's on the move. Time to go. Ackerman pushes himself wearily to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By all means.    Let's follow the children. INT. KITCHEN, "SAFE HOUSE" - DAY Paging through the cookbook, Frank locates the page. He smiles in recognition at the familiar CODE pattern of red dots. He pulls out a PEN...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BATHROOM, "SAFE HOUSE" - DAY Frank examines a sleek, tiny electric razor that resembles a lollipop. Turning it on, he applies it. Pleased, he keeps shaving. Getting out of the shower, Frank enjoys the soft Frette towels. INT. MASTER BEDROOM, "SAFE HOUSE" - DAY In the closets are dozens of flawless, custom-tailored suits. Flipping through the rack like a discerning shopper, Frank arrives at a suit that catches his fancy. Elegant and simple. IN THE MIRROR Frank struggles to close Alexander Pearce's pants around his lightly padded mid-section... a little too tight. Frank is irritated to discover he's not quite as trim as Pearce. ON THE BEDROOM FLOOR Frank engages himself in a spontaneous program of CALISTHENICS. He struggles through a batch of push-ups, then sit ups. IN THE MIRROR Frank flosses his teeth. Then he backs up, taking in his outfit. The lines of the suit highlight his frame. He likes what he sees. INT. DEMIDOV'S HOTEL ROOM - DAY Demidov is getting dressed. It's an elaborate ritual: carefully pressed pants, ironed shirt, starched collar, etc. His two BODYGUARDS stand nervously at attention, watching him. 66.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was a young man, times were very hard. When an opportunity presented itself, you took it. He pats talcum powder on himself.    The men remain stone- faced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was twelve years old when Gregor asked me if I was ready for a man's job. He was the top chelovek in our housing block. So I said yes. He gave me a crowbar and told me to go bash in the skull of another boy who had stolen something from him. He points at his platinum cufflinks on a bedside table and snaps his fingers. Scarface hands them to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now it just so happened this boy was a friend of mine. I did not want to do this terrible thing. But when you come from the streets, you have no choice. He carefully knots his tie in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I worked   very hard for years to get past   that life. So I would not have   to do these terrible things.    So I would have a choice... He turns and smiles at his THICK-NECKED bodyguard.    He gestures toward the man's holstered pistol -- DEMIDOV (CONT'D) I have people like you to do these things for me... He holds out his hand; THICK NECK hands him the pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except that you don't! Suddenly Demidov pistol whips the man across the face! Blood explodes from THICK NECK's nose.     He falls down to one knee, clutching his face in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Scarface looks on in fear. Demidov calms himself almost as quickly as he lost his temper. He drops the gun on the carpet and steps back in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you did your job properly, I wouldn't have to get my hands dirty, you piece of shit. He turns and walks into the bathroom to wash his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. CIPRIANI HOTEL - DAY Heels clicking on the cobblestones, Cara strides quickly along the Palazzo Vendramin en route to the Cipriani. She checks her watch. Then walks faster. She passes a smallish transporto via cargo (supply boat) floating in the lagoon beside the Palazzo. Cara approaches the poolside hotel restaurant. INT. CIPRIANI HOTEL - DAY From a second story SUITE of rooms, The ENGLISHMAN peers through the curtains. He sees Cara seat herself at a TABLE between the pool and the lagoon. His eyes settle on the transporto. Workers step on and off, carrying fresh linens into the hotel. He leaves the window. INT. TRANSPORTO - DAY There is a small cabin on the deck. Inside the cabin, Ackerman, Goyal, a videographer, a signals surveillance officer and a coordinating tactics officer huddle. Ackerman stares out the tinted window. ACKERMAN'S POV - he can just see Cara sitting at the table. 68. EXT. CIPRIANI HOTEL, POOLSIDE RESTAURANT - DAY Fanning herself with a newspaper, Cara discreetly evaluates the men in her sight lines. Venetian civic leaders chatting by the bar, tourists reading maps... Over her sunglasses she catches sight of a pair of YOUNG LOVERS drunk in each other's grasp in the pool. She turns away. INT. TRANSPORTO - DAY Squinting, Ackerman evaluates his placements. - A WAITER, idling at his bussing station, his eyes roaming the palazzo. - A VAPORETTO CAPTAIN, who quietly turns away requests for a ride into St. Marks Square, his finger to his ear. - An OLDER COUPLE sitting a few seats away from Cara. And an AGENTE DI POLIZIA (police patrolman) loud and jovial, joking with passersby, while quietly checking his earpiece. He speaks into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eh, we do not know any further...characteristics?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what we know. EXT. CIPRIANI HOTEL, POOLSIDE RESTAURANT - DAY The VIDEO CAMERA swivels to follow a MAN, elegantly dressed, with trim hair who swiftly approaches Cara's table... IN THE TRANSPORTO Standing up, Ackerman holds his hand up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold...wait for my signal... AT THE RESTAURANT Cara glances up from her menu as she senses the elegant man approaching. The WAITER walks quickly toward Cara's table... The elegant man is FRANK. IN THE TRANSPORTO Ackerman stares at the monitor with Frank's face on it. He's quietly furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that fool doing in the middle of my operation? AT THE RESTAURANT Cara stares slack-jawed at Frank. He has given himself a complete make-over.    New haircut. Pearce's suit fits him well. He looks terrific. Cara notices before quickly recovering her composure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time for Alexander and me to meet face to face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about. Please go, I'd like to have a quiet coffee. Frank sits at the table with Cara and eats a CASHEW. IN THE TRANSPORTO Ackerman barks whispered orders into the speaker:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move off. Move off. The UNDERCOVER WAITER quickly moves away from Cara's table. Ackerman stares at the monitor which captures Cara's angry expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get rid of him! AT THE POOLSIDE RESTAURANT Defiantly, Frank pulls his chair in closer to Cara.    He signals to a different THIN WAITER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caffe, per favore? Frank turns back to Cara, who calls out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cameriere!   No caffe for signor!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With milk! She stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to be dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not particularly, but I'm tired of being afraid. I've been running around like a frightened mouse long enough and I've decided I'm finished. Frank pulls out a Gitane cigarette.   He lights it, smoking while he talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I first saw the name I got scared: "Alexander Pearce." He even sounds like some super cool master criminal with Russian enemies and the beautiful girlfriend... he probably works out. He might own a pizza shop on the side for all I know. Frank frowns at the cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are disgusting. INT. TRANSPORTO - DAY Goyal is seated at the communication station. ON THE MONITOR - Frank is settled in opposite Cara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not going anywhere. Ackerman peers directly out the window, as if he's going to see something different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put Lipetti in. Tell him to play it like he's dealing with a rowdy guest-- escort him out. EXT. CIPRIANI HOTEL, POOLSIDE RESTAURANT - DAY Cara looks all around.   No sign of any suitor approaching. CLOSE ON: the hands of the THIN WAITER, who sprinkles pepper carefully, presumably onto a dish. He then platters the dish and lifts it over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, you have no idea what you're sticking your nose into.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably not. But I'm doing it anyway. Alexander Pearce nearly got me killed. It was his idea, right? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told you to pick out some random sap on the train to take a bullet for him, didn't he? Frank works himself up, drawing courage from his anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I'm not playing the role anymore. I'm going to confront him. He's supposed to meet you here, isn't he? I'm going to tell him exactly what I think of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonderful. Another macho idiot. (to the waiter) Conto, per favore! Frank leans in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the lure, Cara? Obviously not his character. Is it the money? The luxury? What's any of that worth if you're getting shot at and you could go to jail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's smooth, right? He probably has mistresses in every European city, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really a shame you've scared him off-- She tosses some Euros on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two of you make a nice couple. The THIN WAITER arrives with a PLATTER.   He sets it down in front of Cara. The UNDERCOVER WAITER now moves toward the table with a grim expression... The THIN WAITER removes the platter.   Cara looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Spelled out in SALT and PEPPER on the plate is the following: "MY VILLA.    TONIGHT. 8PM." Cara no sooner reads it than the Thin Waiter, who we now see is THE ENGLISHMAN... ...BLOWS on the platter, scattering the salt and pepper granules to the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? As Frank looks up. The Englishman has already turned away, but the Undercover Waiter is moving quickly toward Cara's table. The Undercover Waiter picks up speed, changing course slightly. WE SEE he's after The Englishman who is about to enter the restaurant kitchen... Then FRANK steps in front of The Undercover Waiter, mistaking him for Pearce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank! INT. TRANSPORTO - DAY Ackerman slaps the cabin table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abort!   Abort, goddammit! THE POOLSIDE RESTAURANT The Undercover Waiter tries to move past Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hide out poolside and send your girlfriend and a total stranger to face the murderers who are after you? Not much of a tough guy, are you? Frank SHOVES him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where I come from, we don't treat women like that! Frank grabs the Undercover Waiter's collar with unaccustomed strength. Cara quietly picks up her bag and leaves the restaurant. She walks as fast as she can without being noticed toward the Palazzo Vendramin. In the midst of his scuffle, Frank looks around and realizes she's gone. The Undercover Waiter's earpiece falls out in the melee... Frank sees it and hesitates. Maybe this guy isn't Pearce. INT. TRANSPORTO - DAY Getting up from his seat in the cabin, Ackerman gestures for the captain of the transporto to leave the dock. ON THE MONITOR: Frank looks around and sees Cara:     fifty feet away. Walking with purpose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That goddamn fool. Ackerman rubs his face and squats down, frustrated beyond measure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do with him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throw him in the lagoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. PALAZZO VENDRAMIN - DAY Frank brushes past tables, hits the street and RUNS down the Palazzo, toward Cara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cara! Cara says nothing. She just shoots Frank an angry glance and climbs onto A VAPORETTO (water taxi).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Frank runs to the edge of the water as it motors away. Suddenly he feels the presence of somebody behind him. TWO of ACKERMAN'S MEN are right there. They pin his arms forcefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok Signor... you can come with us now. Frank looks at the two big men on either side of him. Then at Cara disappearing over the water. The fight drains out of him and he doesn't resist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - DAY Frank sits alone in the sparsely furnished, windowless room. A table, two chairs. A large mirror on the wall. Frank straightens his slightly disheveled suit, as if he's been dumped here without ceremony. He glances in the mirror periodically, suspicious. The door opens and Ackerman enters. He pulls up one of the chairs and gestures for Frank to do the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please... He looks Frank up and down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's borrowed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a good fit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately. Ackerman reaches into his breast pocket and takes out his INTERPOL credentials. Tosses them on the table for Frank to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police... better than the alternative I suppose. Ackerman smiles. Frank remains defiant.      He jerks his head toward the mirror confidently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's watching from behind there? Ackerman looks over at the mirror, taken off guard by the question. He stands and goes to the mirror -- lifts it off its hooks and sets it on the floor. Nothing but plain wall underneath. Ackerman sits back down. Frank is a little bit chastened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a vivid imagination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't needed it lately. Ackerman smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in for a disappointment. I'm not Alexander Pearce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that. Frank looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since when?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since the beginning. Frank stares at him blankly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come. I want to show you something Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 77. INT. INTERPOL FIELD HQ, VENICE - DAY Ackerman leads Frank through the maze of desks and police. Various members of the task force follow their progress... Jean Luc, Jones, etc. They arrive at a central INTEL area where Goyal sits in front of several computer monitors. He looks up as Ackerman and Frank arrive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull up the CID Academy graduating class for 2002. Goyal raises an eyebrow, but does as he's told. A few moments later a photo of POLICE RECRUITS in uniform comes up on screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a good look. Frank peers at the screen. He spots the instructor-- Ackerman seven years younger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a look at the second row. INSERT CLOSE UP on the screen. Frank examines the second row. One of the young women is... CARA MASON. Her hair is pulled back. She looks more the determined police cadet than the sexy siren...  but it's definitely her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cara... He is dumbfounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been watching you this entire time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw those men try to kill me and you didn't intervene?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to apprehend a major criminal. I'm not a babysitter. Frank grows angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to speak with somebody at the American Embassy. I'm going to tell them that you and your undercover officer knowingly and recklessly endangered the life of an American citizen! Let's see what my government has to say about that! Jones clears her throat from a chair across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're aware of the situation, Mr. Taylor. But we take a long view of these things... fortunately you are unhurt... Frank is incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll go to the press. I'll tell the entire story to the New York Times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   I don't think you'll do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I don't think you want to see Cara's entire career destroyed. Frank falls silent. Ackerman puts an arm around his shoulder and leads him away from the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Espresso?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 79. EXT. INTERPOL FIELD HQ, VENICE - DAY Frank stands on a balcony overlooking a waterway. Ackerman emerges with two cups of espresso. Hands one to Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Women like Cara don't come along very often.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In my case, they don't come along at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's the worst combination: stunning looks and a brilliant mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she's so smart, how did she get caught up with Pearce?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It started out as a straightforward placement... INT. DOGE'S PALACE - DAY [FLASHBACK] Cara (younger) poses as an art student, sketching a SCULPTURE in the Anticollegio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...we ran her deep cover to build a case against Pearce. It took. He hired her as an assistant. She turns her face and smiles at an UNSEEN MAN. EXT. YACHT - DAY [FLASHBACK] The wind blows in Cara's hair. She sits on the top deck. A MAN'S HAND passes her a drink as he walks by. She smiles at him (again we do not see his face).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she began missing drops. Omitting important details.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. BALCONY - RESUME SCENE Ackerman turns to Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was no longer with us.   She was with him. Ackerman finishes his espresso.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She explains it now as the confusion of her new life outside the academy. That I misread her capacity for this kind of work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why are you still using her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's all I have, Mr. Taylor. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think she'll turn him in this time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Goyal walks up behind Ackerman waiting patiently for a moment to interrupt him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do know however, that you are very smitten with her. Frank looks back at him evenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not just me, is it? Ackerman acknowledges the point with the barest of nods. Goyal signals that Ackerman has a phone call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 81. EXT. GRAND SALONE, VENICE - DAY The principal apartment of a Venetian palazzo, looking out over the Grand Canal. Cara holds her cell phone to her ear as she walks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cara?     Where have you been? INTERCUT WITH ACKERMAN on the phone at his office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you got him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean the idiot who ruined our operation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you got him? Ackerman glances out the window at Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Cara is relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your own fault. We never should have endangered a civilian. You should have put an agent into place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was no time. Besides Pearce is too smart for that; he would have spotted the agent a mile away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't spot me. Ackerman smiles bitterly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apparently he didn't have to. Cara doesn't answer. Ackerman regrets the jibe.   He steps into a HALLWAY where it's quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry Cara. That was uncalled for. ON HER FACE as she listens to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on edge because of our failure today. If only the American hadn't messed everything up... I felt sure Pearce would show up today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you think he didn't? Ackerman's face lights up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. INTERPOL FIELD HQ, VENICE - DAY Ackerman strides into the room, calling for attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay everybody, listen up. Jones, Quinn, Jean Luc and the rest of the team assemble. Goyal has Frank with him, dragging him around like a lost puppy dog...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a location and time for the next meet.    Pearce's villa. Eight o'clock. We have to move fast--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pearce's own villa? Why would he risk going back there? He must know we'd be watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps he's nostalgic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doubt that. Maybe there's something of value still there. He left in a hurry after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call in a search team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We searched the place after the raid last year. If there's anything hidden there, only Pearce knows where it is. He picks up his coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to get agents in place all around the villa. Frank speaks up unexpectedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're all around his house, will he show up? A dozen heads turn to look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I needed your advice Mr. Taylor, I'd ask. Frank shrinks down in his chair. A beat.   Ackerman turns back to the rest of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Establish a wide perimeter. We'll keep our distance and wire the entire villa for video surveillance. The meeting breaks up.   Everybody jumps into action. ON QUINN as he slips out a side door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. CIPRIANI HOTEL - DAY A standard hotel room-- no lavish suite this time. Cara stands in front of the mirror. Her shirt is unbuttoned as she works to attach a TINY MICROPHONE to her bra. The tape gets stuck to itself and she has to start over... A KNOCK on her hotel room door. 84.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. Frank enters the room.    Sees her half-dressed--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.   Come over here.    I need your help. In an echo of their first meeting on the train (but without the false flirtation) she turns to him and hands him a piece of tape. Their eyes meet.   A flicker of a smile passes between them. Frank's fingers are perfectly steady this time as he helps her secure the microphone and do up her shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ackerman told me everything. She takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no apology necessary. He steps back from her.    She smooths her blouse.   Turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like the most beautiful woman on earth. The complete honesty and directness of his compliment takes her by surprise. She's strangely moved by it. She brushes her hand affectionately over his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When will you go home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ackerman asked me to stay with the surveillance team in case the thugs who came after me at the Danieli show up. I'm the only one who can identify them. Something occurs to Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you tell him to keep an eye on me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told him to make sure you were safe until this was over. He nods.   A little pleased at her concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't worry about me. What about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do? She takes a beat, then puts her game face on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA - NIGHT A light mist. The sound of water lapping against the shore. The scene is familiar... almost identical to the night of the raid just over a year ago. Then a wind picks up and blows the mist clear. REVEAL an undercover POLICEMAN with an earpiece walking a dog a block away... ON A ROOFTOP three blocks away -   A SNIPER with a scope. INSIDE AN APARTMENT - a FEMALE AGENT with binoculars scans the empty street below. 86. ON THE CORNER - two blocks down is a village CHURCH. INT. CHURCH - CONTINUOUS Ackerman and his team have set up a make-shift surveillance outpost here. The high-tech equipment looks incongruous with the thousand year-old stone walls and worn oak pews. A bank of monitors reveals various views of the inside and outside of Alexander's villa. Frank hovers in the background behind Ackerman. He notices Ackerman has a copy of the International Herald Tribune.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all read the same newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a good paper. And sold throughout the world. Makes the classified ads especially useful... Frank nods. Ackerman sits down next to Frank as if he were an old pal instead of a quasi-captive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since the internet came about, hardly anybody uses old school methods like that to communicate anymore. Except Alexander Pearce. No lines to tap. No signals to intercept. (admiringly) He's a very clever man, your double.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I look forward to meeting him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I. EXT. WATERWAY - NIGHT A PATROL BOAT circles in the canal behind the villa.   One of Ackerman's ITALIAN AGENTS is at the wheel. He sees a flat-bottomed black BOAT motoring toward him. A light from the boat shines in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to turn around, sir. There's been a chemical spill in this area-- FWWWAP! A silenced bullet strikes him in the forehead. The agent topples into the water with a gentle splash. The black boat steers around the rudderless patrol boat and heads toward the villa... INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA - NIGHT BINOCULAR POV - a lone female figure walks down the cobblestone streets toward the villa. CARA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's approaching the destination now. EXT. BACK OF THE VILLA - NIGHT The black boat slips underneath some moorings. A gloved hand tosses a grappling hook up to a beam ten feet overhead. It catches. The boat is tied off. Silently, a masked figure begins to climb from the boat up into the bottom floor of the villa in the semi- darkness. INT. SURVEILLANCE OUTPOST IN CHURCH ON THE MONITOR WE SEE PEARCE'S ENTRY HALL. Cara unlocks the front door with a key and walks inside. INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA/VIDEO MONITORS - CONTINUOUS TRACK from screen to screen as WE FOLLOW Cara moving through the deserted rooms. Everything is cold and lifeless.   Like a palace that has been turned into a museum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CHURCH - CONTINUOUS While everyone is focused on the monitors showing Cara's progress, Frank notices some movement in a monitor far off to one side... It shows the lower floor of the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that? They all turn to look. A male figure, his face masked, approaches the lens of the surveillance camera... BLINK!   The FEED shuts off. Ackerman barks at a technician.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened? Get it back on line! The surveillance techs begin madly punching buttons, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that Pearce?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did he know there would be a camera? BLINK!   Another monitor goes dark.   Then another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's taking out the entire surveillance system--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't! He's cutting the feed at the source. Frank looks anxiously at Cara on the monitor climbing the stairs... Blink! She disappears from view as well.      Everybody starts talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can one man move through the house that fast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What should we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up!    Everyone. They quiet down.   Ackerman turns to the tech.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we still have audio? The tech nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn it up. Everybody in the Church stands stock still.    Staring at the dark monitors. Listening. Cara's footsteps click up the stairs and then slow... They move tentatively across the floor. WE HEAR A THUMP.   A door or a heavy footstep? Cara's breathing gets louder.    There's somebody else in the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alexander? No response.   Click, clack, click... She takes a few steps. ON FRANK -- concerned. ON ACKERMAN -- calm. INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA, PENTHOUSE - NIGHT Cara stands in the center of the large room. She catches sight of her reflection in the large floor-to-ceiling window. There's a movement in the doorway behind her... She spins around to face... DEMIDOV.   He and his two men have removed their masks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to disappoint you, my dear. He steps toward her. Cara pales. INT. CHURCH - NIGHT Everybody strains to hear what is happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you this evening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The accent is Russ--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh! (quietly) It's Ivan Demidov. Jones looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not possible. INTERCUT WITH THE VILLA Cara takes a step back toward the window.   Demidov follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're waiting for someone, Ms. Mason? Cara doesn't reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't seen Alexander Pearce in a long time, yes? I'm sure it will be a touching reunion. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't mind, we'll keep you company while you wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to wait for Alexander Pearce. Just like them. EXT. ROOFTOP - NIGHT SNIPER'S POV - CARA has maneuvered close enough to the window that she is visible. As they approach, Demidov and his two men come into range as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's brought them to the window... INT. CHURCH - CONTINUOUS Everybody is listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...there are three of them. ON FRANK'S FACE - he looks around at the cops desperately hoping somebody will do something. They all look to Ackerman. INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA, PENTHOUSE - NIGHT Demidov circles Cara dangerously close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not very polite of your boyfriend to keep you waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loses track of time easily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a hard time believing that. (pause) Perhaps he's already here somewhere... hiding... even watching us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INSIDE THE CHURCH DEMIDOV (V.O.) (CONT'D) What do you think? A long silence.    The tension grows.   Then we hear... A LOUD SLAP. Everyone in the room flinches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know... I have a feeling he is around here somewhere. And if he cares about you... if he wants to see your lovely face again... he should show up before it's too late. ANOTHER SLAP - MORE VICIOUS THAN THE FIRST.      This time Cara cries out in pain. Goyal turns to Ackerman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Demidov's right. He's here somewhere... Another SLAP.    Another scream. Jean Luc looks to his colleagues-- Jones, Quinn... then turns to Ackerman. Every one of them is about to burst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to do something--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes but--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's my agent. She's my responsibility. A muffled THUD. Cara groans and WE HEAR her body hit the floor. That wasn't a slap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Every cop in the room is clenching his weapon. Desperate for the order to move. To jump in and stop this. They are all looking to Ackerman to give the order. As the silence wears on, even Jones starts to waver. She speaks quietly to Ackerman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if he doesn't come? Ackerman doesn't respond. The lack of sound in the church is even more disturbing than before. Suddenly Goyal notices...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Taylor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - NIGHT Frank runs for all he's worth.    Panting for breath. INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA - NIGHT Frank bursts through the front door.      Races to the steps without hesitating... INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA, PENTHOUSE - NIGHT Cara lies on her side at Demidov's feet.     Blood trickles from the side of her mouth. Her eyes are clouded with fear and pain as she views the room half-askew. Then they suddenly come into focus as she sees... A figure walks into the room.    FRANK. He stand motionless in the doorway, surprisingly calm. Demidov turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good news. He loves you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Demidov's men take Frank by either arm and roughly drag him forward. Cara lifts her head with an effort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not Alexander Pearce. Demidov ignores her and walks up to Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Mr. Pearce, I thought I was finished with this sort of thing. But in your case, I've been forced to make an exception. He holds out his hand and one of his THUGS gives him a PISTOL and a SILENCER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is NOT Alexander Pearce! Demidov begins screwing the silencer onto the barrel. The thugs push Frank to his knees. But he's barely paying attention to them.    His eyes are locked on Cara. She meets his gaze. For a moment, it's as if nothing else in the world exists but the two of them. He may only be a hapless tourist, but he loves her. He's the one here, willing to give up his life to save hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Frank...   I'm so sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing to be sorry for. Demidov finishes attaching the silencer.    He points the gun at the back of Frank's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good bye Mr. Pearce. At this moment, Cara fills her lungs and screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ackerman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She bends her head toward her cleavage, yelling into the tiny microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ackerman!! Demidov is taken off guard. INT. CHURCH - CONTINUOUS Her scream echoes through the arched church. Ackerman gives the order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it. EXT. ROOFTOP - NIGHT SNIPER'S POV - Demidov and his gun-wielding henchmen standing over Frank and Cara. INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA, PENTHOUSE - CONTINUOUS The huge, plate glass window shatters as the high powered bullet slams through it! Everything explodes in a mass of blood and glass. SCARFACE is blown off his feet. His body hits the ground next to Frank... his gun skitters across the floor. Demidov looks from the window to Cara with cold fury in his eyes-- she's the one who has called in the artillery. He raises his pistol toward her, point blank. BANG!    The gunshot takes him by surprise.   He turns to see... FRANK holds Scarface's smoking pistol in his hand. Demidov just has time to process the fact that Frank is the one who shot him before the life drains from his eyes and he topples... Demidov's other bodyguard fires out the windows wildly and makes a run for it. Glass flies everywhere. Frank throws his body over Cara to protect her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A short and furious exchange of gunfire as the other plate glass windows explode. Wood splinters fill the air as furniture is torn apart. Finally... One of the sniper's bullets finds its target and the BODYGUARD goes down. Frank remains on top of Cara, shielding her until long after everything has fallen silent. EXT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA - NIGHT Ackerman and his team approach, guns drawn. Undercover agents converge as well, closing the perimeter. INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA, PENTHOUSE - NIGHT Frank and Cara sit in the middle of the room amongst a sea of broken glass. Just getting over the shock of being alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right? Cara nods. She looks at him for a long moment, then breaks out into a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did well to choose you on the train... Frank's turn to smile.   He looks around the room at the carnage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't get to arrest Alexander Pearce...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He never showed up. Frank slides closer to her. Gently, carefully, he slips his hands into Cara's cleavage. Surprised, Cara starts to pull back-- but he puts a finger to her lips. She hesitates... looks at him questioningly. But she doesn't protest as his fingers move toward her bra...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ...and grasp the tiny MICROPHONE. With a sharp tug, he rips it free. He tosses it across the room. Then he leans a little closer and whispers in her ear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wrong. I'm here. She straightens up.   Her heart skips a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me.   I'm here. She covers her mouth.   Her eyes mist over with tears. She runs her fingers over his face with loving amazement. Like a blind person trying to recognize a familiar face. Her mind reels... Then their lips meet. They kiss. And kiss.      Like drinking from a fresh spring in the desert. Finally she pulls away and looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said I'd told so many lies, you wouldn't believe me even if I did tell the truth... This was the only way to convince you. (pause) The truth is that I love you. All that matters is that you believe me. She stares into his eyes for a beat. Finally looking at her without a trace of deception. She believes. They hear voices on the stairs below. Frank holds up a finger to her-- wait. Frank crawls across the room and presses a hidden latch on a built-in bookshelf. It swings out of the way to reveal a hidden safe built into the floor. Frank removes the fitted floor boards. There is a sophisticated BIO-METRIC LOCK -- just like the one at the gate in the beginning of the movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Frank places his finger on the spot and the lock clicks open. CUT TO: INT. ALEXANDER'S VILLA - NIGHT TRACK WITH ACKERMAN up the stairs. He leads the team into the PENTHOUSE. He looks around at the mess as the agents fan out. Cara leans on Frank's arm as she heads for the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cara... I want the paramedics to make sure you're all right-- She blows right past him.     Ackerman calls out after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cara... She pauses.   Turns to face him. Ackerman looks down for a moment, ashamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... I... we'll talk about this later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No we won't. There's nothing to talk about. I don't work for you anymore. She walks past him.    For a moment Ackerman and Frank look at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr.   Taylor...   you're free to go. He looks at Frank with a measure of begrudging respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems I underestimated you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems you did, Mr. Ackerman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . With that, Frank steps out of the room.    Ackerman's attention is distracted by--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir... over here. Take a look at this! Goyal has found the safe.   Ackerman comes over and looks. INSERT CLOSE UP - the only thing in the safe is a single FLASH DRIVE. Goyal signals to one of the TECHS. He opens a laptop on the desk and they plug in the FLASH DRIVE to check the contents. While they are doing this, Ackerman bends to inspect the BIO-METRIC LOCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was here. Jones looks on eagerly as numbers fill the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Account numbers... access codes... unless I'm mistaken... he left the money behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mistake perhaps?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is there? Goyal scans down to a total...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like 744 million.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's no mistake... (walks over) That's his tax bill. She holds out her hand to the TECH who has just removed the FLASH DRIVE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take that. She slips it into her pocket, then turns to Ackerman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ackerman has moved away. He's staring down at the ground -- from behind he looks like a man defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well John... with the funds recovered, I don't think there's going to be any appetite from our side to continue this investigation. Ackerman's shoulders are slumped, staring at Demidov's dead body on the ground. Jones puts a hand on his back, consoling him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry you didn't get your man. Then Ackerman turns... a big smile on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh but I did get my man, Ms. Jones. She realizes; he was after Demidov all along. Ackerman nods to Goyal, a twinkle in his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Goyal, you may place Mr. Quinn under arrest now. Quinn is taken completely off guard. Before he can move, Goyal and another agent have placed him in handcuffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You thought I didn't know? You were unwittingly quite helpful; without you Mr. Demidov might have escaped justice. He turns to Jones with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After all, Demidov wasn't a target of this investigation, was he? Ackerman walks over to the window as Quinn is led away. ACKERMAN'S POV - Cara and Frank walk toward the canal in the street below. A WATER TAXI approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something I don't understand... how did Pearce manage to get here and open that safe without anybody noticing? And where did he go? Ackerman stands at the window with his hands behind his back. For the briefest of moments, Frank looks back up at him and their eyes connect. Frank gives him a little smile.   Cara takes his arm to climb onto the boat. CLOSE ON ACKERMAN:   his eyes narrow.   He knows. For a moment he doesn't move. Then, in spite of himself, a small smile creeps over his face too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because Pearce was cleverer than all of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. WATER TAXI - NIGHT Cara and Frank step on board. The DRIVER starts the engine. He turns to REVEAL... that he is the "ENGLISHMAN" we've seen throughout the movie. He and Frank look at one another for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $20 million dollars worth of surgery and that's the face you chose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's good to see you too. They embrace warmly. Cara is in disbelief, realizing just how completely Frank/Alexander has planned things out. She casts one last glance backwards.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: SURVEILLANCE OUTPOST IN CHURCH ON THE MONITOR WE SEE PEARCE'S ENTRY HALL
